name: Park Inn by Radisson San Jose, Costa Rica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a most pleasant three day stay at Park Inn in San Jose Costa Rica. Highly recommend, without hesitation. The staff was super kind, the room larger than expected with all necessary ammenities for a confortable stay. Breakfast was delicius: best Galo Pinto I had in my whole stay in Costa Rica. Should I need to come back to San Jose, would certainly return.
reviews.title: Beat my expectations!!!

reviews.text: I went to visit my Costa Rican friends and i was looking for a place to stay in San José, usually everybody and the internet's first choice is the Intercontinental but wait, next time you visit San José you better start trying something new, the Park Inn. Since you check in you can feel the welcoming atmosphere from the staff, the rooms are outstanding, great shower and super clean bathroom which is a must for me, nice towels, comfortable beds with nice linens, the wifi works at a fast pace and the gym is good enough for a quick workout.
reviews.title: Amazing Surprise

reviews.text: But maybe one of the things amazed me the most was the manager, Norman Monge, you can easily tell he loves his job and he would always make a big effort to make you feel as comfortable as possible. I play tennis and in San José is almost impossible to find a court, i don't know how but Norman just nailed it, he found one for me and also help me with recommendations/reservations for nice restaurants.
reviews.title: Practical and Neat!

reviews.text: So overall i can just say Park Inn is highly recommended and of course i will stay there next time !!!
reviews.title: Stay in style in San José

reviews.text: I was there for the Correcaminos marathon! Incredibly awesome! Loved it, clean, downtown and practical gor everything I needed, the reservation guy... July 6th 1 pm...great! Thanks guy...Karla Hidalgo Diaz
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first time in Costa Rica and the Park Inn was a great place to start our holiday. Very warm welcome from the friendly staff who really went out of their way to make us feel at home. Modern, stylish surroundings and comfortable room with good free wifi. Buffet breakfast was good quality and plentiful with a wide choice of food. We also had an excellent evening meal which was good value and served with a smile.
reviews.title: Lovely introduction to Costa Rica

reviews.text: The surrounding area feels a little 'edgy' but we walked to and from the city centre (20 minutes) without any problem and it's only a short taxi ride away if you did feel uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Costa Rica tour with Gate 1 travel and Radisson Hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from Costa Rica this week. Totally enjoyed the entire experience and especially the accommodations. The Radisson was an excellent choice and far exceeded my expectations. The service from the entire staff was fantastic. The food (breakfast included) was superb. I have used Gate 1 Travel several times and continue to rave about their superior service. Especially in picking the best hotels. I give the Radisson "2 thumbs Up!" along with the 5 star rating.
reviews.title: I recommend Park Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I tell all my family and friends to check out Gate 1 travel. They won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Good start to see SJO and surroundings

reviews.text: I stay at this hotel on business, and is the resting place for an executive, spacious rooms, friendly staff, very good restaurant, and complimentary breakfast very tasty and varied, if I return to Costa Rica back to Park inn.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, restaurant service needs to improve

reviews.text: My friends and I stayed here from 8/1 - 8/4 before traveling to Guanacaste. The hotel is very clean, new, and updated. The rooms are all new and look trendy. The gym was clean, and provided water, towels, and fruit. Not a bug in site! The staff were extremely friendly and helped whenever asked. They gave us directions to the bar, mercado, and the bus stop. One night they even called a restaurant for me because I didn't know how to ask certain questions in Spanish! They have a happy hour by the pool Monday - Friday, which helped because It rained everyday from 2-5pm lol. The breakfast was included in the stay and was outstanding. Beans and rice, plantains, eggs, meat, cheese, pastries and bread, tons of fruit, juice etc. If you are looking for a nice hotel near downtown San Jose, this is it. Absolutely beautiful. Thank You so much. Mi Amigas loved our trip to Costa Rica!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: Excellent hotel, really modern spacious rooms with super comfy large beds and flat screen TV. The breakfast was also included which was good, plenty of fresh fruit, eggs and coffee.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel & staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool are is small but nice and is very pretty at night.
reviews.title: Park Inn breaks the Mold

reviews.text: Good location too, 30 mins from the airport and a short taxi ride or 20 min walk into the city.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: A special mention must go to Danko the concierge who helped us book our trip to La Paz, his English is really good and he is extremely friendly. Thanks for a great stay!
reviews.title: Park Inn by Radisson, San Jose, Costa Rica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a long overdue review. I stayed at the Park Inn in early August--4 nights at the beginning of my trip and 2 nights at the end. The hotel is new, spotless, nicely furnished and features nice, natural lighting. The mattress was a little firm for my liking but the shower (with consistently hot water) made up for it.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in San Jose

reviews.text: The location is hard to beat. It's a very short walk to the main thoroughfare (Paseo) where buses can be found to reach all areas of the city, yet it's tucked far enough away from Paseo to ensure a quiet night's sleep. For a perspective on location, read other reviews on the very, expensive Gran Oro hotel which is only one block from the Park Inn.
reviews.title: Great hotel! Nice and clean

reviews.text: Restaurants, except unsightly U.S. fast-food chains, don't abound within an easy walking distance. A few can be found (i.e. Aqui Es, Gran Oro, and Lubnan) but don't expect great variety without relying on taxis or buses. After long days of sightseeing, we ate dinner at the Park Inn on two occasions. The food was just fine and priced on par with comparable restaurants in San Jose. The complimentary breakfast buffet offers something for everyone: fresh fruit, cheese, baked goods, juice, coffee, gallo pinto, breakfast meats, eggs and a rotation of sides (i.e. potatoes, pancakes, etc.) My only complaint about breakfast was the consistently slow service for coffee refills.
reviews.title: AN OASIS IN SAN JOSE

reviews.text: The staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. They helped arrange transportation to the airport, allowed us to park our rental car right by the front door so we could quickly load/unload our bags from/to our room, exchanged small amounts of money each day, and helped us with directions. The most incredible customer service moment, however, was when we returned to the hotel for the second part of our stay. We had a commitment at 11:00 a.m. the morning we returned and had no choice but to deposit our bags at the hotel before that commitment. We didn't expect to be able to check-in but only wanted to leave our bags. When we arrived, they said "No problem" and gave us our room right away! Awesome service!
reviews.title: Modern, clean, spacious and comfortable stay close to the heart of San José

reviews.text: There is absolutely no doubt that the Park Inn is our permanent hotel of choice when we're in San Jose.
reviews.title: August in San Jose

aka: Park Inn By Radisson San Jose, Costa Rica
description: We are located just steps from Paseo Colon, SJ's main avenue and walking distance from downtown. Just minutes from the major business and shopping centers of our capital. We are a new, fresh, fun, and environmental friendly hotel of 125 rooms beautifully designed, including 10 suites (60mts2) ideal for long stays. In addition to our RBG Restaurant Bar & Grill, we offer 2 Bars, one located next to the pool, Gym, Business Center & Outdoor Pool located on the 3rd floor. Also we offer underground free Parking and 10 Meeting Rooms to accommodate up to 250 people
